result.execSummary:
The defendant Drew M Striegel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 81 days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: Any other sentence currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes:
DNA surcharge ($250), Court costs ($268) and Buy Money ($120) to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.  Can be taken out of priso wages.
AMENDED 08-12-2016:  DNA sample and surcharge are waived.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Drew M Striegel in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.
Repeater enhancer is struck.



Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  3.5 Years.
Initial Confinement:  1.5 Years.
Extended Supervision: 2 Years.
Concurrent to:  Anyother Sentence Presently Serving.
81  Days Credit.


CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.



Buy Money:  $120 - to be paid to Waukesha CountyMetro Drug Unit.
Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence (can be taken out of prison wages).

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  

Defendant to be returned to Columbia Correctional - Forthwith.
Hearing on July 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant to be produced by July 16, 2015 from Columbia Correctional Institution
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Drew M Striegel in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Defendant can be returned forthwith to Columbia Correctional.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
